column2: NEW HAMPSHIRE PRACTICE PERMIT TEST
Question Text
1. When driving on roads that may be slippery:
column4: use cruise control to maintain a steady speed.
column8: do not make any sudden changes in direction or speed.
column10: always drive at the highest speed allowed.

column2: 2. What do pennant-shaped signs indicate?
3. When driving at night, you should slow down and:
column4: use high beams whenever possible, but never when there's oncoming traffic.
column6: use high beams until other drivers dim their lights.
column8: come to a complete stop whenever there's oncoming traffic.
column10: follow the vehicle ahead more closely to avoid glare from oncoming headlights.

column2: 4. When drivers see this road sign:
column4: they must come to a complete stop and call the police.
column6: they must treat it as a 4-Way Stop sign.
column10: they must not drive past this sign.

column2: 5. This road sign means:
6. This traffic sign warns you about:
column6: a hill or a downgrade up ahead on the road.

column2: 7. When you make a left turn from a one-way road into a two-way road, you must:
column4: enter the two-way road to the left of its center line.
column6: make a U-turn into the two-way road.
column8: enter the two-way road to the right of its center line.
column10: turn left into the one-way road.

column2: 8. BAC is expressed in:
column8: ounces of alcohol in your blood.

column2: 9. Alcohol causes:
10. Speed limit signs are:
11. This road sign means:
12. Directions given by traffic officers ___________ signs, signals or pavement markings.
13. A few drinks after work before driving home:
column4: are acceptable as far as they are part of your daily routine.
column6: have no effect on your driving ability.
column8: should be avoided because they impair your judgement.
column10: should be avoided unless you really need them.

column2: 14. While inside the roundabout, you should:
column4: remain in your lane until you are ready to exit.
column6: change lanes before you check for vehicles behind you.
column8: use your left turn signal if you are in position to exit now.

column2: 15. In the following situations, drivers should increase their following interval:
column4: When following vehicles that are required to come to a stop at railroad crossings.
column6: When it is hard to see ahead because of bad weather.

column2: 16. What is the main reason night driving is more difficult than daytime driving?
column6: The use of headlight is required by law.

column2: 17. This sign means:
column6: The highway ahead is divided into two one-way roadways.
column8: The divided highway on which drivers are traveling ends ahead.

column2: 18. What should you do in case of a steering failure?
column6: Don't panic. Turn on your emergency lights to let other drivers know you are having car problems. Move toward the side of the road and bring the car to a gradual stop.
column8: Pump your gas pedal a few times to increase the pressure.

column2: 19. Hydroplaning is a situation in which:
column4: one of your tires goes flat, causing the others to skid.
column6: the tires of the car ahead cause sheets of water to splash on your vehicle.
column8: your tires throw water to the rear, causing problems for the vehicles behind.
column10: your tires ride up on a thin surface of water, losing contact with the pavement, and resulting in sudden loss of control

column2: 20. Signs and markings requiring that you obey the indicated instruction are known as _____ signs.
21. This sign means:
column4: The traffic signal ahead is out of order
column10: you must yield to the traffic signal ahead.

column2: 22. When they see this sign, drivers should:
column4: increase their speed and keep well to the right.
column6: slow down and keep well to the right.
column10: slow down and keep well to the left.

column2: 23. Which of the following does NOT affect the distance that it takes to stop your vehicle?
24. Distractions that take your attention away from driving can be caused by ______ while driving.
25. If one of your tires blows out, you should:
column4: pump your brakes and steer where you want to go.
column8: apply your brakes gently and steer smoothly where you want to go.
column10: hold the steering wheel tightly, slowly take your foot off the gas pedal and steer smoothly where you want to go.

column2: 26. BAC is:
column4: the number of ounces of alcohol in your blood.
column6: the percentage of alcohol in your blood.
column8: the amount of alcohol in your body.

column2: 27. You face a green light, but traffic on the other side of the intersection does not allow you to travel all the way through the intersection. What must you do?
column4: Enter the intersection and wait until traffic ahead clears.
column8: Wait until traffic ahead clears, so you do not block the intersection.
column10: Wait for the next green light.

column2: 28. Anything that requires you to _______ could cause you to crash.
column4: take your hands off the wheel
column6: take your eyes off the road
column8: take your attention away from driving

column2: 29. Work zone signs:
column4: provide information on road work or other temporary road conditions.
column6: mean that drivers should drive faster to get out of the work zone.
column8: mean that drivers must come to a complete stop and back up.
column10: mean that road conditions will improve soon.

column2: 30. Drinking alcoholic beverages:
column4: gives you a feeling of false confidence.

column2: 31. This road sign means:
32. You ________ traffic headed toward you when you turn left.
33. When driving in bad weather, drivers should:
column8: increase their speed to get to their destination more quickly.

column2: 34. Does a vehicle prepared to enter a traffic circle or rotary have right-of-way over vehicles in the circle?
column4: Only if the light is green.
column6: No. Vehicles already in the circle have the right-of-way.
column10: Yes, but only if they are entering the rotary from the right lane.

column2: 35. You are driving in the left lane and want to change to the right lane. Before changing lanes, you should check your mirrors, signal and:
column8: accelerate slightly before looking around your vehicle.
column10: look over both shoulders for vehicles in front of you.

column2: 36. Drivers may continue carefully through a yellow light if:
column8: they already are within the intersection.
column10: an emergency vehicle is crossing your lane.

column2: 37. This road sign means:
column10: The road ahead is closed to traffic

column2: 38. When driving on slippery roads, drivers should:
39. An edge line that angles toward the center of the road indicates that:
40. What should you do if your rear wheels start to skid?
column4: Steer left if your rear wheels slide right.
column6: Take your foot off the gas and shift to neutral.
column8: Turn the steering wheel in the direction the vehicle is trying to go.
column10: If the vehicle has ABS, pump the pedal carefully.
